void EagleLogger_Delete ( EagleLogger *  logger  ) 

Delete a logger.

Note:
Do not call this function unless you have a good reason. Once the logger is created it will be reused automatically.
Parameters:
[in] logger The logger to free.

EagleLogger* EagleLogger_Get ( void   ) 

Get the default logger.

If the default logged has not been initialised it will be initialised automatically and returned.

Returns:
The default logger.

00080         lock = EagleSynchronizer_CreateLock();

FILE* EagleLogger_GetLogFile ( const char *  location  ) 

Get the file handle for a log location.

If the log file cannot be open then stderr is returned.

Parameters:
[in] location The file location.
Returns:
Always a valid FILE handle, even in case of failure.

00116         return;

00120     EagleSynchronizer_Lock(logger->logLock);

00123     timestamp = ctime(&event->when);
00124     timestamp[strlen(timestamp) - 1] = '\0';
00125

00127         fprintf(logger->out, "%s: [%s] %s\n", timestamp, EagleLoggerSeverity_toString(event->severity), event->message);
00128         fflush(logger->out);
00129     }
00130     ++logger->totalMessages;
00131     
00132     /* track most recent event */
00133     if(NULL != logger->lastEvent) {
00134         EagleLoggerEvent_Delete(logger->lastEvent);
00135     }
00136     logger->lastEvent = event;
00137     
00138     EagleSynchronizer_Unlock(logger->logLock);
00139 }

EagleLogger* EagleLogger_New ( FILE *  out  ) 

Create a new logger.

This is really only used for tests, you should use EagleLogger_Get() to get the default logger.

Parameters:
[in] out The file stream to send the error messages to.
Returns:
A new logger.
